body_html: With tensoflow-gpu (1.5.0) + cuda 9.0 + ubuntu 16.04 in virtualenv: the same error when importing tensorflow in the virtualenv's python3 interpreter. I think it is because it is not enough to set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH properly; You should run the ldconfig after installing the cuda toolkit. So I put the cuda lib path /usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64 (in my config) into the newly created file /etc/ld.so.conf.d/cuda.conf, issued an ldconfig and now it works finally.

body: With tensoflow-gpu (1.5.0) + cuda 9.0 + ubuntu 16.04 in virtualenv: the same error when importing tensorflow in the virtualenv's python3 interpreter. I think it is because it is not enough to set the `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` properly; You should run the `ldconfig` after installing the cuda toolkit. So I put the cuda lib path `/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64` (in my config) into the newly created file `/etc/ld.so.conf.d/cuda.conf`, issued an `ldconfig` and now it works finally.
